com.mosguinz.javanetflixroulette

Class NetflixLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mosguinz.javanetflixroulette.NetflixLibrary

  • public class NetflixLibrary
extends Object
    The NetflixLibrary class is responsible for interacting with the Unofficial Netflix Online Global Search (uNoGS) API and performing related operations on its responses.

    The class is responsible for operations, such as:

    • sending GET requests to the uNoGS API;
    • extracting and validating responses from the API;
    • selecting random titles from given parameters.
    Author:
    mosguinz

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetflixLibrary

        NetflixLibrary()
        Set up an instance of NetflixLibrary.

        Upon instantiation, the instance will:

        • obtain the API key provided in the environment variable under the key X_RAPID_API_KEY;
        • fetch the list of available Netflix regions;
        • fetch the list of genres;

        Key must either be present in the environment variable under X_RAPID_API_KEY or be provided when prompted.

        Returns:
        a RapidAPI key for uNoGS

      • fetchData

        private org.json.JSONArray fetchData(String queryType)
        Fetch the data for the given queryType.

        The method will fetch the data for the given queryType by looking for responses saved in the local machine first. If that is not available, then it will send a request to the uNoGS API to obtain the data.

        Parameters:
        queryType - must be either fetchGenres, fetchTitles, or fetchAvailableRegions
        Returns:
        a JSONArray of the requested data

      • sendQuery

        public org.json.JSONArray sendQuery(String queryType)
        Send a GET request to the uNOGS API server.

        Will only be invoked if there is no responses saved or if the saved responses are out-of-date or not valid.

        When invoked, it will also attempt to:

        • verify whether the response is valid;
        • extract the response into a suitable format;
        • write the response to file, so that it can be used later.
        Parameters:
        queryType - must be either fetchGenres, fetchTitles, or fetchAvailableRegions
        Returns:
        a JSONArray of the requested data if the response was successfully validated and extracted; null otherwise

      • extractSupercategoryGenres

        private static org.json.JSONArray extractSupercategoryGenres(org.json.JSONArray response)
                                                      throws NoSuchFieldException
        Extract response for the list of genres and its IDs.

        For some reason, items in the "ITEMS" key are nested in single key-pair values for each genre, where the key is the genre names and its value is an array containing numerical ID(s) that are associated with the genre.

        This method maps the SUPERCATEGORY genre names to the list of IDs of its SUBCATEGORIES.

        Assumes that the response is in the format where the SUPERCATEGORIES are listed FIRST and starts with the word "All".

        For example, the SUPERCATEGORY of "Action" titles may contain SUBCATEGORIES, such as "Action Comedies," "Action Sci-Fi & Fantasy," "Action Thrillers," etc.

        So, the list of IDs that includes those SUBCATEGORIES genres will be listed under the key "All Action". And the individual IDs of those SUBCATEGORIES can be found later on in the response.

        Parameters:
        response - the raw response in the form of JSONArray from the API
        Returns:
        a JSONArray of the (supercategory) genres, where each entry is a JSONObject with the key being the genre name, if the response is in an expected format; null otherwise
        Throws:
        NoSuchFieldException - if the response is not in the expected format

      • extractAvailableRegions

        private static org.json.JSONArray extractAvailableRegions(org.json.JSONArray response)
                                                   throws NoSuchFieldException
        Extract response for the list of available regions and its IDs.

        The response contains a lot of other information aside from the internal ID, such as region pricing, currency, etc -- likely from the result of web scraping. These information are filtered out as they are unnecessary.

        Parameters:
        response - the raw response in the form of JSONArray from the API
        Returns:
        a JSONArray of the available Netflix regions, where each entry is a JSONObject with the key being the region name, if the response is in an expected format
        Throws:
        NoSuchFieldException - if the response is not in the expected format

      • verifyResponse

        public static org.json.JSONArray verifyResponse(org.json.JSONObject response)
                                         throws NegativeArraySizeException
        Verify that the response is valid.

        The content of a valid response from the UNoGS API is always an array (parsed as JSONArray) under the key "ITEMS". If this key-pair is not present in the JSON, then the response is assumed to be invalid.

        Parameters:
        response - the JSONObject returned from the query
        Returns:
        the content of response as a JSONArray if the response is valid; null otherwise
        Throws:
        NegativeArraySizeException - if the response is blank -- i.e., if the query did not match any results

      • extractResponse

        public static org.json.JSONArray extractResponse(org.json.JSONArray response,
                                                 String queryType)
                                          throws NoSuchFieldException
        Call methods respective to the given queryType to extract its response.
        Parameters:
        response - the raw response in the form of JSONArray from the API
        queryType - must be either fetchGenres, fetchTitles, or fetchAvailableRegions
        Returns:
        a JSONArray of an extracted response if successful; null otherwise
        Throws:
        NoSuchFieldException - if the response is not in the expected format

      • getRegionID

        private String getRegionID()
        Get the numeric ID for the corresponding region to use in the query string.
        Returns:
        the numeric ID of the specified region, queryRegion, to be used in the query string.
        See Also:
        https://rapidapi.com/unogs/api/unogs?endpoint=56770144e4b0c2a9f0e83c8e for more info about region IDs

      • getGenreIDs

        private String getGenreIDs()
        Get the numeric IDs for the corresponding genres to use in the query string.
        Returns:
        the numeric IDs of the specified genres, queryGenres, to be used in the query string; the IDs for the genres are a comma-separated string
        See Also:
        https://rapidapi.com/unogs/api/unogs?endpoint=5676f219e4b04efee9356e43 for more info about genre IDs

        {@link #extractSupercategoryGenres(org.json.JSONArray)} on how genres are extracted and handled in this application

      • setTitlesQueryString

        private void setTitlesQueryString()
        Construct and set a query string to use for requesting titles.

        Because the way parameters are passed with this API is just so f*cking abhorrent, the query string just look absolutely disgusting and nonsensical.

        The query parameters passed for this endpoint aren't actually "parameters" that would have otherwise been separated by ampersands. Most of them are crammed under the parameter q, which are then separated by !-.

        The best part is, the order at which the parameters are shown on the API docs page AREN'T EVEN IN THE SAME ORDER AS THE ACTUAL QUERY STRING. WHY?!?!??!

        The order of the parameters in the query string is:

        q={query}-!{syear},{eyear}-!{snfrate},{enfrate}-!{simdbrate},{eimdbrate}-!{genreid}-!{vtype}-!{audio}-!{subtitle}-!{imdbvotes}-!{downloadable}&t=ns&cl={clist}&st=adv&ob={sortby}&p={page}&sa={andor}

        Most of which, can be ignored for the purpose of this application. They have all been hard-coded to include all of the titles, so that only the five parameters that will be set by this application -- i.e., region, genres, title type, minimum IMDB rating, and maximum IMDB rating -- will be the only factors that filters out the titles. Which boils the parameters down to:

        q=-!0,3000-!0,10-!{MIN_IMDB_RATING},{MAX_IMDB_RATING}-!{GENRE_IDs}-!{TITLE_TYPE}-!Any-!Any-!-!&t=ns&cl={COUNTRY_LIST}&st=adv&ob=Relevance&p=1&sa=or, where:

        • GENRE_IDs is a list of selected genres, represented by their IDs and separated by a comma;
          • if all genres are selected, the ID is 0
        • COUNTRY_LIST is a list of selected regions, represented by their IDs and separated by a comma;
          • if all regions are selected, the ID is all
          • from this application, users can only choose to include all regions or one region only; there is very little to no use case where a user would need to filter for two or more specific regions
          • note that these country codes are not the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes, such as US, NZ, AU, etc., as noted in the API documentation
        • TITLE_TYPE is the type of title to include in the results; and
          • this value is either Any, Movie, or Series
        • MIN_IMDB_RATING and MAX_IMDB_RATING are the minimum and maximum IMDB rating values to include in the results
          • this value is between 0.0 to 10.0 in one decimal point accuracy (tenths)
        See Also:
        https://rapidapi.com/unogs/api/unogs?endpoint=5690bcdee4b0e203818a6518 for this endpoint's documentation
